meanings.definition: The act of forming a flange.
meanings.sent1: The flangings on the pipe were done carefully to ensure a secure connection.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic inspected the flangings to make sure they were properly shaped.
meanings.sent3: The flangings on the metal sheet looked like little folded wings.
meanings.sent4: She admired the precision of the flangings, comparing them to the petals of a flower.
meanings.sent5: The bright red color of the flangings made them stand out against the dull background.

meanings.sent1: He ran his finger along the sharp flangings of the metal plate.
meanings.sent2: The flangings of the pipe were painted in bright yellow for visibility.
meanings.sent3: The flangings of the wheel resembled tiny teeth ready to bite.
meanings.sent4: The flangings of the door caught the light, creating a shimmering effect.
meanings.sent5: She accidentally cut her hand on the rough flangings of the machinery.

meanings.definition: The process of attaching a flange to something.
meanings.sent1: The flangings of the pipe were completed with precision by the welder.
meanings.sent2: The flangings of the metal sheet were secured tightly to prevent leaks.
meanings.sent3: The flangings of the machine were attached using heavy-duty bolts.
meanings.sent4: The flangings of the structure were carefully welded together for strength.
meanings.sent5: She observed the intricate flangings being attached to the pipeline.
